oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kriterien zur Stickstoffeffizienz moderner Winterweizensorten und deren Eignung für low-input Anbausysteme
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schneider, David
Charles, Dr Raphaël
Mascher, Dr Fabio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nitrogen deficiency is one of the most important reasons for reduced quality and yield stability in wheat production under low-input conditions. The present project intends to develop criteria allowing to find varieties that are adapted for low-input agricultural conditions. Therefore, yield and nitrogen uptake and use dynamics of eleven modern wheat varieties have been studied under low and high input conditions on a long term field experiment in Changins. This preliminary report shows that nitrogen efficiency defined as yield per available nitrogen is a useful criterion to distinguish nutrient efficiency under high nitrogen conditons but not when nitrogen is lacking. In further studies we will focus on backing quality as a potential indicator for nitrogen efficiency at low nitrogen conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schneider, David; Charles, Dr Raphaël and Mascher, Dr Fabio (2009) Kriterien zur Stickstoffeffizienz moderner Winterweizensorten und deren Eignung für low-input Anbausysteme. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
